CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1958, pg, A3, reads: "Rib Fans and Chow Line - The smell of barbecued ribs was the order of the day at South Park's Sully's Grove on Sunday, when factions of the United Steelworkers of American made 'peace' at a picnic arranged by members of the 'rank and file' and 'fair share' groups. in left photo, watching USW international representative Boyd L. Wilson tickle the ribs with his fork are, left to right: Bob Shannon, District 15 staff; James DeBow, Rankin local; Paul Hilbert, District 15 director; Carl Dickerson, Duquesne local; Emery Bacon, USW education director and a Congressional candidate; Ernest Clifford of Clairton local; Cliff Montgomery and John Hughey, Braddock local... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Boyd L. Wilson squatting over barbecue with bag of Hickory Charcoal Briquets, and Bob Shannon, James DeBow, Paul Hilbert, Carl Dickerson, Emery Bacon, Ernest Clifford, Cliff Montgomery, and John Hughey standing behind him, at United Steelworkers of America picnic at Sully's Grove, South Park
